extendedIngredients.name: corned beef
extendedIngredients.original: 3 (1/8-inch-thick) slices cooked corned beef (4 ounces), fat trimmed, chopped (3 tablespoons reserved, divided)
extendedIngredients.originalName: (1/8-inch-thick) slices cooked corned beef , fat trimmed, chopped (3 tablespoons reserved, divided)

extendedIngredients.name: parsnips
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large parsnips (about 13 ounces), peeled, coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: savoy cabbage leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 3 large savoy cabbage leaves, center ribs removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: savoy cabbage leaves, center ribs removed

title: Parsnip Soup with Corned Beef and Cabbage
summary: Need a gluten free and primal main course? Parsnip Soup with Corned Beef and Cabbage could be a super recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.53 per serving. One serving contains 531 calories, 24g of protein, and 27g of fat. This recipe is typical of European cuisine. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 30 minutes. It is perfect for st. patrick day. A mixture of low-salt chicken broth, onions, savoy cabbage leaves, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the heavy whipping cream you could follow this main course with the Homemade Strawberry Shortcake with Grand Marnier Whipped Cream as a dessert. It is brought to you by Epicurious. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is spectacular. Cabbage & Corned Beef Soup, Corned Beef and Cabbage Soup, and Corned Beef and Cabbage Soup are very similar to this recipe.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Sauté 2 tablespoons corned beef fat and bay leaves in large saucepan over medium-high heat until fat renders, about 2 minutes. Stir in parsnips and onions. Add 3 cups broth. Cover; simmer until parsnips are tender, about 10 minutes.                                                                Meanwhile, cut cabbage and corned beef slices crosswise into very thin strips. Melt 1 tablespoon fat in medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add cabbage and corned beef. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss until cabbage wilts, about 3 minutes.                                                                Working in batches, puree soup with bay leaves and cream in blender until smooth. Return to same pan. Rewarm soup, thinning with more broth if too thick. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Mound corned beef and cabbage in center.                                                                         One (first-course) serving contains the following: 248.19 Calories (kcal), 42.2 % Calories from Fat, 11.63 g Fat, 5.66 g Saturated Fat, 51.91 mg Cholesterol, 26.91 g Carbohydrates, 6.04 g Dietary Fiber, 8.61 g Total Sugars, 20.87 g Net Carbs, 10.51 g Protein                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Bon Appétit

steps.step: Sauté 2 tablespoons corned beef fat and bay leaves in large saucepan over medium-high heat until fat renders, about 2 minutes. Stir in parsnips and onions.
Add 3 cups broth. Cover; simmer until parsnips are tender, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cut cabbage and corned beef slices crosswise into very thin strips. Melt 1 tablespoon fat in medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss until cabbage wilts, about 3 minutes.

Working in batches, puree soup with bay leaves and cream in blender until smooth. Return to same pan. Rewarm soup, thinning with more broth if too thick. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Mound corned beef and cabbage in center.
